heading: super sunday
subheading: upwards of 7,000 people will descend upon wolverhampton, england on the last sunday of january for a curious sort of competition: they will drag crosses weighing between 40 and 50 pounds over a grueling 2,000-yard course, a trial designed to replicate jesus christ's walk to calvary. these words from the sponsor: "to commemorate the torture of the original tough guy ... every entrant will sign up as a jesus warrior. each competitor will simulate the passion and carry a huge cross to calvary." it also says: "jesus christ was not meek and mild. he is the toughest tough guy of all time." a spokesman for the roman catholic church was not amused.
